transcriptText:
This double Indian clubs exercise is built on a parallel heart shaped swing. One hand goes behind the back to perform a low back circle, while the other hand does a wrist circle to the inside of the body.

From there you can add layers, with extra circles under the armpit or over the shoulder.

If you need something easier, we can teach you step by step through the basics. And we also have lots of challenging combinations to keep you busy for a while.

Check out our video tutorials and programs on our website www.heroicsport.com

WHY YOU SHOULD SWING INDIAN CLUBS

Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion

Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion

Consists of compound movements in multiple planes

Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise

Assists recovery from intense training

Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

It is fun and you forget you are training.

The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.

Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ HEROIC SPORT | AN ANCIENT SPORT

Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors.

Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

therefore explore the crazy 88 with our two rocks wood clubs so the complex is based off a parallel hardship swing now we're going to add a lower back circle and a wrist circle to the inside of the wrist once we've got that we're gonna add the next layer which is an armpit circle so go boom arm hit circle and behind the back back to the normal armpit circle behind the back boom the next layer is over the shoulder under the armpit lower back over under behind the back and then you've got the herrick slide transition

![Thumbnail (1920x1080)](https://i.ytimg.com/vi_webp/9nBK1pyyYVU/maxresdefault.webp)
# [Club swinging 103 Lesson 12/13:  Crazy 88 complex (with layers)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9nBK1pyyYVU)

**Visibility**: Public
**Uploaded by**: [Heroic Sport - Indian clubs workouts](http://www.youtube.com/@HeroicSport)
**Uploaded at**: 2020-09-04T00:33:29-07:00
**Published at**: 2020-09-04T00:33:29-07:00
**Length**: 01:03
**Views**: 1641
**Likes**: 51
**Category**: Sports

## Description

```
This double Indian clubs exercise is built on a parallel heart shaped swing. One hand goes behind the back to perform a low back circle, while the other hand does a wrist circle to the inside of the body.
From there you can add layers, with extra circles under the armpit or over the shoulder.
If you need something easier, we can teach you step by step through the basics. And we also have lots of challenging combinations to keep you busy for a while.
Check out our video tutorials and programs on our website www.heroicsport.com

WHY YOU SHOULD SWING INDIAN CLUBS
〄 PHYSICAL ASPECTS
Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion
Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion
Consists of compound movements in multiple planes
Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise
Assists recovery from intense training 
Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)
〄 MENTAL ASPECTS
It is fun and you forget you are training.
The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.
Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ HEROIC SPORT | AN ANCIENT SPORT 
We have created the Pahlavandle ™ and the Pahlavandle™XL to make it affordable for everyone to discover the benefits of swinging clubs.
Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors. 
Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.
```

## Transcript

therefore explore the crazy 88 with our two rocks wood clubs so the complex is based off a parallel hardship swing now we're going to add a lower back circle and a wrist circle to the inside of the wrist once we've got that we're gonna add the next layer which is an armpit circle so go boom arm hit circle and behind the back back to the normal armpit circle behind the back boom the next layer is over the shoulder under the armpit lower back over under behind the back and then you've got the herrick slide transition


## Endscreen
    
- [The Ace of clubs |  Follow along workout #4 | Video 21/21](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NKH_pKiuM6E)
